intro: Sotor aethiopum, commonly known as the Ethiopian sotor, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 2,000 meters. The leaves are usually elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
